Data:¶

aopy.data.get_ecube_data_sources(data_dir)¶

Lists the available data sources in a given data directory

Inputs:

data_dir [str]: eCube data directory

Output:

sources [str array]: available sources (AnalogPanel, Headstages, etc.)

aopy.data.load_bmi3d_hdf_table(data_dir, filename, table_name)¶

Loads data and metadata from a table in an hdf file generated by BMI3D

Inputs:

data_dir [str]: path to the data filename [str]: name of the file to load from table_name [str]: name of the table you want to load

Outputs:

data [ndarray]: data from bmi3d metadata [dict]: attributes associated with the table

aopy.data.load_bmi3d_sync_clock(data_dir, filename)¶

Just a wrapper around load_bmi3d_hdf_table()

aopy.data.load_bmi3d_sync_events(data_dir, filename)¶

Just a wrapper around load_bmi3d_hdf_table()

aopy.data.load_bmi3d_task(data_dir, filename)¶

Just a wrapper around load_bmi3d_hdf_table()

aopy.data.load_eCube_analog(path, data_dir, channels=None)¶

Just a wrapper around load_ecube_data() and load_ecube_metadata()

Inputs:

path [str]: base directory where ecube data is stored data_dir [str]: folder you want to load (opt) channels [int array]: which channels to load

Output:

data [nCh, nt]: analog data for the requested channels metadata [dict]: metadata (see load_ecube_metadata() for details)

aopy.data.load_ecube_data(data_dir, data_source, channels=None)¶

Loads data from eCube for a given directory and datasource

Requires load_ecube_metadata(), process_channels()

Inputs:

data_dir [str]: folder containing the data you want to load data_source [str]: type of data (“Headstage”, “AnalogPanel”, “DigitalPanel”) channels [int array or None]: list of channel numbers (0-indexed) to load. If None, will load all channels by default

Output:

timeseries_data [nCh x nt]: all the data for the given source

aopy.data.load_ecube_digital(path, data_dir)¶

Just a wrapper around load_ecube_data() and load_ecube_metadata()

Inputs:

path [str]: base directory where ecube data is stored data_dir [str]: folder you want to load

Output:

data [nt]: digital data, arranged as 64-bit numbers representing the 64 channels metadata [dict]: metadata (see load_ecube_metadata() for details)

aopy.data.load_ecube_metadata(data_dir, data_source)¶

Sums the number of channels and samples across all files in the data_dir

Inputs:

data_dir [str]: eCube data directory source [str]: selects the source (AnalogPanel, Headstages, etc.)

Output:

metadata [dict]: Dictionary of metadata with fields - samplerate [float]: sampling rate of data for this source - data_source [str]: copied from the function argument - n_channels [int]: number of channels - n_samples [int]: number of samples for one channel

aopy.data.load_hdf_data(data_dir, hdf_filename, data_name)¶

Simple wrapper to get the data from an hdf file as a numpy array

Input:

data_dir [str]: folder where data is located hdf_filename [str]: name of hdf file data_name [str]: table to load

Output

data [ndarray]: numpy array of data from hdf

aopy.data.load_hdf_metadata(data_dir, hdf_filename)¶

Simple wrapper to get metadata from an hdf file

Input:

data_dir [str]: folder where data is located hdf_filename [str]: name of hdf file

Output

metadata [dict]: key value parameters

aopy.data.load_optitrack_data(data_dir, filename)¶

This function loads a series of x, y, z positional data from the optitrack .csv file that has 1 rigid body exported with the following settings: - Markers: Off - Unlabeled markers: Off - Quality Statistics: Off - Rigid Bodies: On - Rigid Body Markers: Off - Bones: Off - Bone Markers: Off - Header Information: On - Optitrack format Version(s): 1.23

Required packages: pandas, numpy

Inputs:

data_dir [string]: Directory to load data from filename [string]: File name to load within the data directory

Outputs

mocap_data_pos [nt, 3]: Positional mocap data mocap_data_rot [nt, 4]: Rotational mocap data

aopy.data.load_optitrack_metadata(data_dir, filename, metadata_row=0, mocap_data_col_idx=array([2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]))¶

This function loads optitrack metadata from .csv file that has 1 rigid body exported with the following settings: - Markers: Off - Unlabeled markers: Off - Quality Statistics: Off - Rigid Bodies: On - Rigid Body Markers: Off - Bones: Off - Bone Markers: Off - Header Information: On - Optitrack format Version(s): 1.23

Required packages: csv, pandas

Inputs:

data_dir [string]: Directory to load data from filename [string]: File name to load within the data directory

Outputs

mocap_metadata [dict]: Dictionary of metadata for for an optitrack datafile

aopy.data.proc_ecube_data(data_dir, data_source, hdf_filename)¶

Loads and saves eCube data into an HDF file

Requires load_ecube_metadata()

Inputs:

data_dir [str]: folder containing the data you want to load data_source [str]: type of data (“Headstage”, “AnalogPanel”, “DigitalPanel”) hdf_filename [str]: name of hdf file to be written (or appended??)

Output:

None

aopy.data.process_channels(data_dir, data_source, channels, n_samples, dtype=None, data_out=None)¶

Reads data from an ecube data source by channel until the number of samples requested has been loaded. If a processing function is supplied, it will be applied to each batch of data. If not, the data will be appended

Inputs:

data_dir [str]: folder containing the data you want to load data_source [str]: type of data (“Headstage”, “AnalogPanel”, “DigitalPanel”) channels [int array]: list of channels to process n_samples [int]: number of samples to read. Must be geq than a single chunk dtype [numpy dtype]: format for data_out if none supplied data_out [nCh, nt]: array of data to be written to. If None, it will be created

Output:

data_out [nchannels, n_samples]: Requested samples for requested channels

aopy.data.save_hdf(data_dir, hdf_filename, data_dict=None, params_dict=None, append=False)¶

Writes data_dict and params into a hdf file in the data_dir folder

Inputs:

data_dir [str]: destination file directory hdf_filename [str]: name of the hdf file to be saved (opt) data_dict [dict]: the data to be saved as a hdf file (opt) params_dict [dict]: metadata key value pairs (opt) append [bool]: append an existing hdf file or create a new hdf file

Output: None
